intro: Thymelaea gattefossei, commonly known as the Cape York thymelaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Thymelaea gattefossei is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
